title: Reddit Was Built On Legions of Fake Accounts | The Mary Sue
excerpt: Reddit has never been a place where you could necessarily connect one user with one account. Parody accounts are commonplace -- to a fault if you ask some -- and there have been more than one fiasco involving users who pretend to be different people with different accounts; it's crazy. It's also extremely fitting. Why? Because when Reddit was first started, it was populated almost entirely with content submitted by fake users.
